text: let's bring you the latest pictures that
we've just had in from the French
interior ministry in the last couple of
minutes this is the crash site and as
you can see absolutely treacherous
terrain there very very difficult for a
plane to navigate through and clearly
freezing conditions we know now that
that crash site is on the mountain twice
a week it's some 2,600 feet above sea
level and although there were some
police on the site within half an hour
or so of the accident it's very
difficult for more than around 30 or so
people we understand to be on that site
because it's right on the edge of a
cliff we can't show you any of the
debris or any of the exact location but
this is the terrain where the plane went
down very difficult for a helicopter to
land near the site and when you're
looking at these as they come in to us
you begin to understand why the French
president for so long has said it's
unlikely that there will be survivors
from this crash
